questions.question: Which chemical is used to liberate iodine from potassium iodide in the iodometric titration of bleaching powder?

explanations.c: Sulfuric acid is used to acidify the solution. In an acidic medium, chlorine (from bleaching powder) reacts with potassium iodide to liberate iodine. The liberated iodine is then titrated with sodium thiosulphate.

questions.question: What is the role of sodium thiosulphate in this experiment?

explanations.b: Sodium thiosulphate reduces the liberated iodine (I₂) back to iodide (I⁻). It gets oxidized to tetrathionate in the process.
